name: Hard Skeleton Words11 Quiz / Test | Word Play | 25 Questions

questions.text: RKNSS (An American state)
KBB (A dish consisting of small pieces of meat, tomatoes and onions threaded onto skewers and often grilled over charcoal)
questions.explanation:
Kebab & Kabob.

	Special thanks to caliber66 for 'kabob' an alternative spelling of kebab.

questions.text: NNSNS (Drivel, unintelligible language)
NSL (Out of the ordinary)
TMBRN (Percussion instrument)
questions.explanation:
Tambourine & Tambourin.

	Special thanks to Mister E76 who came up with 'tambourin' which is a small drum.

questions.text: CKLND (The largest city and chief port of New Zealand)
MG (A letter of the Greek alphabet)
STM (To have great respect or high regard for)
NTRS (Infamous)
NQSTV (Excessively curious)
THLL (Shakespearean play)
R (Any flat, curved or irregular expanse of a surface)
PNC (A remedy for all diseases or ills)
BHS (A German school of architecture and applied arts founded in 1919 by Walter Gropius)
TTCC (A famous lake)
questions.explanation:
Titicaca.

	A lake between south Peru and west Bolivia in the Andes, drained by the Desaguadero River and flowing into Lake Poopo.

questions.text: SSG (A southern African tree or the wood of which is used for making spears)
PRSSN (A Jane Austen novel)
CRSR (A pirate)
STT (Former Hindu custom whereby a widow burnt herself to death on her husband's funeral pyre)
T (A small usually ornamented case for holding needles, cosmetics or other small articles)
CC (Any tropical or subtropical shrub or tree having compound or reduced leaves and small yellow or white flowers)
LBQRQ (A city in central New Mexico on the Rio Grande)
DDLS (In Greek mythology an Athenian architect who built the labyrinth for Minos on Crete)
questions.explanation:
Daedalus & Daedelus.

	He also fashioned wings for himself and his son Icarus to flee the imprisonment on the island.

questions.text: HBKKK (Hebrew prophet and book of the Old Testament)
G (A river in west central Africa which flows through Gabon to the Atlantic Ocean)
questions.explanation:
Ogooue.

	The river is also spelt 'Ogowe'. Hope you enjoyed this tricky quiz.
